West Ham boss Slaven Bilic has admitted Andy Carroll practises his scissor kicks in training - and it makes him crazy. 
Carroll scored a wonder goal against Crystal Palace on Saturday to help the Hammers to a 3-0 win and heighten the Eagles' relegation fears. 
And Croatian Bilic has revealed that the former Newcastle striker has less luck in training when trying to pull off the spectacular goals - and that he watches between his fingers. 
"It was a very difficult game for us, a very difficult week," Bilic said. "But the team showed everything we asked for - determination, character. The first half was nervous but the crowd were brilliant. Carroll celebrates his goal (Photo: Arfa Griffiths/West Ham United via Getty Images) Bilic admits the striker practising his scissor kicks makes him 'crazy' (Photo: Arfa Griffiths / West Ham United FC) 
"Second half we made a change at half-time and we were magnificent. We gave everything, scored three really good goals and were compact and solid. 
"I can only congratulate the boys, they were amazing. And I would like to thank the fans who were magnificent. 
"Andy Carroll has got it but he was unlucky in training when he was trying it - he was hitting the post or whatever. With his history of injuries I go a bit crazy when he does that in training because you don't want him to get hurt." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
